intro: Notylia orbicularis subsp. orbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular notylia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its round, broad leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant's botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native environment, making it a notable species in regional flora.
